content:
MessagingFactory Class

Definition

The MessagingFactory class is the anchor class used for run time operations to send and receive to and from queues, topics, or subscriptions.

In this Article

public abstract class MessagingFactory : Microsoft.ServiceBus.Messaging.ClientEntity
Inheritance
Object
ClientEntity
MessagingFactory

Inherited Members

Abort()
Close()
CloseAsync()
Fault()
IsClosed
OnBeginOpen(TimeSpan, AsyncCallback, Object)

OnFaulted()

OnOpened()

ThisLock

ThrowIfDisposedOrImmutable()
ThrowIfDisposedOrNotOpen()
ThrowIfFaulted()

Remarks

Please note that any member method with CreateXXXClient, such as CreateQueueClient, does not create a new entity in the namespace. It only gets handle to an existing entity created earlier using the . If these entities does not exist in the namespace, you will get an exception.

Properties

Address

Gets the base address of the messaging factory.
NamespaceEndpoints

Gets a list of namespace endpoints.
PrefetchCount

Gets or sets the number of messages that the message receiver can simultaneously request.
